title: 112_s170
content: The Act titled "Helping Responsible Homeowners Act" allows for affordable refinancing of mortgages owned or guaranteed by Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac. The "Helping Responsible Homeowners Act" defines key terms such as Director, Enterprise, and Qualified mortgage, which includes criteria for a mortgage to be considered qualified. The "Helping Responsible Homeowners Act" defines key terms and criteria for qualified mortgages, including those owned or guaranteed by Federal agencies and current on payments. A refinancing mortgage must repay existing debt and closing costs. The refinancing mortgage must be on the same property as the qualified mortgage being refinanced, have a fair interest rate not exceeding 40 basis points above the required net yield, not be limited by loan-to-value ratio, and waive prepayment penalties. The Federal National Mortgage Association and the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation shall provide refinancing for qualified mortgages on single-family housing, with waived prepayment penalties and a maximum 40-year term to maturity. The program established by the Federal National Mortgage Association and the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation allows for refinancing of qualified mortgages on single-family housing without prepayment penalties and with a maximum 40-year term. The program requires the purchase or guarantee of refinancing mortgages upon request, prohibits additional fees beyond standard guarantee fees, and addresses resubordination of second liens. The program established by the Federal National Mortgage Association and the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation allows for refinancing of qualified mortgages on single-family housing without prepayment penalties and with a maximum 40-year term. New mortgages originated by a servicer or creditor holding a second lien on a qualified mortgage who refuses to resubordinate that lien will be ineligible for purchase or guarantee by the Federal National Mortgage Association or the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation. The Director may extend the program in 1-year increments after the initial 1-year period. Regulations will be issued to carry out the program. The Federal National Mortgage Association and the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation require mortgage servicers to inform borrowers about the refinancing program. The Director will include updates on the program in the monthly Foreclosure Prevention & Refinance Report.
